generif.text: Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Coimmunoprecipitation and immunocytochemistry revealed that DEPDC1 interacted and colocalized with zinc finger transcription factor ZNF224, a known transcriptional repressor.
Inhibition of DEPDC1A, a bad prognostic marker in multiple myeloma, delays growth and induces mature plasma cell markers in malignant plasma cells.
DEPDC1 regulates vincristine-induced cell death by promoting JNK-dependent degradation of the BCL-2 family protein MCL1.
High DEPDC1 mRNA expression is associated with hepatocellular carcinoma/
DEPDC1, plays a pivotal role in the regulation of proper mitotic progression.

Results suggest that protocadherin 10 (PCDH10)-Dishevelled, EGL-10 and Pleckstrin domain containing 1 (DEPDC1)-caspase signaling may be a novel regulatory axis in endometrial endometrioid carcinoma (EEC) development.

miR-130a is an epigenetically regulated miRNA involved in regulation of key molecular and phenotypic features of prostate carcinogenesis, acting as a tumour suppressor miRNA by targeting SEC23B and DEPDC1.
The results of this study suggest that DEPDC1 represents a target molecule for the treatment of glioma.
DEPDC1a, but not DEPDC1b, was required for the integrity of centrosome and organization of the bipolar spindle

DEPDC1 mRNA and protein expression levels were dramatically increased in prostate cancer tissues and cell lines. Overexpression of DEPDC1 promoted, but depletion of DEPDC1 inhibited cell proliferation by regulating the G1-S phase cell cycle transition.
Our results demonstrated that increased expression of SDP35/DEPDC1A and XPT1/DEPDC1B correlates with metastatic progression of metastatic soft tissue sarcoma
Differential DEP domain containing 1 (DEPDC1) expression level shows diagnostic and prognostic significance in liver hepatocellular carcinoma (LIHC) samples.

DEPDC1, negatively regulated by miR-26b, promotes cell proliferation and tumor growth via up-regulating FOXM1 expression, implying an important underlying mechanism of regulating the progression of triple negative breast cancer.
MicroRNA-374c-5p inhibits the development of breast cancer through TATA-box binding protein associated factor 7-mediated transcriptional regulation of DEP domain containing 1.
High DEPDC1 expression is associated with hepatocellular carcinoma cell proliferation, invasion and angiogenesis.
High expression of DEPDC1 in tumor tissue appears to be associated with tumor progression and poor prognosis
DEP Domain Containing 1 Promotes Proliferation, Invasion, and Epithelial-Mesenchymal Transition in Colorectal Cancer by Enhancing Expression of Suppressor of Zest 12.
DEPDC1 up-regulates RAS expression to inhibit autophagy in lung adenocarcinoma cells.
Overexpression of gene DEP domain containing 1 and its clinical prognostic significance in colorectal cancer.
DEPDC1 upregulation promotes cell proliferation and predicts poor prognosis in patients with gastric cancer.
Long noncoding RNA KTN1 antisense RNA 1exerts an oncogenic function in lung adenocarcinoma by regulating DEP domain containing 1 expression via activating epithelial-mesenchymal transition.
[DEPDC1 is Highly Expressed in Lung Adenocarcinoma and Promotes Tumor Cell Proliferation].
ALPK2 acts as tumor promotor in development of bladder cancer through targeting DEPDC1A.
Linc-ROR facilitates progression and angiogenesis of hepatocellular carcinoma by modulating DEPDC1 expression.
Long non-coding RNA DEPDC1-AS1 promotes proliferation and migration of human gastric cancer cells HGC-27 via the human antigen R-F11R pathway.
FOXO3amodulated DEPDC1 promotes malignant progression of nephroblastoma via the Wnt/betacatenin signaling pathway.
Silencing eL31 suppresses the progression of colorectal cancer via targeting DEPDC1.
DEPDC1 as a crucial factor in the progression of human osteosarcoma.
Glycolysis-Related Gene Analyses Indicate That DEPDC1 Promotes the Malignant Progression of Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma via the WNT/beta-Catenin Signaling Pathway.
DEPDC1 and KIF4A synergistically inhibit the malignant biological behavior of osteosarcoma cells through Hippo signaling pathway.
Comprehensive analysis and validation reveal DEPDC1 as a potential diagnostic biomarker associated with tumor immunity in non-small-cell lung cancer.

name: DEP domain containing 1
summary: Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Involved in negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated. Located in nucleus. Part of transcription repressor complex. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
